pkgmetadata.longdescription:
flux is a blazing-fast, async command-line downloader for Linux and Windows. It uses segmented range requests, adaptive scheduling, and mirror-aware balancing to squeeze as much bandwidth as possible out of every host.
Features: - Async Rust core built on Tokio and Reqwest with rustls - Segmented multi-connection downloads with dynamic concurrency tuning - Robust resume support via .kdl.partmap sidecar files - Mirror awareness to balance segments across multiple URLs - Bandwidth shaping with a leaky-bucket limiter - Automatic preallocation to reduce fragmentation - Optional SHA256 verification - Rich progress reporting with adaptive TTY output or JSON streaming
